0: What is the title of the document being referred to in the text?

Based solely on the reference material provided, the title of the document being referred to is:
"H. CON. RES. 1 - CONCURRENT RESOLUTION REGARDING CONSENT TO ASSEMBLE OUTSIDE THE SEAT OF GOVERNMENT"
What is the section of the United States Code that the text references?

Based solely on the reference material provided, the section of the United States Code that the text references is:
Title 17, Section 105.
What is the purpose of the resolution mentioned in the text?

Based solely on the reference material provided, the purpose of the resolution mentioned in the text is to grant permission for the Speaker of the House and the Majority Leader of the Senate, or their respective designees, to notify Members of Congress to assemble at a place outside of the District of Columbia if, in their opinion, the public interest warrants it.
Who are the individuals authorized to notify members of the House and Senate to assemble outside the District of Columbia, according to the text?

Based solely on the reference material provided, the individuals authorized to notify members of the House and Senate to assemble outside the District of Columbia are:
1. The Speaker of the House of Representatives
2. The Majority Leader of the Senate
3. Their respective designees
This information can be found in the text of H. CON. RES. 1, specifically in clause 4, section 5, article I of the Constitution.
What is the date on which the resolution was passed by the House of Representatives, according to the text?

Based solely on the reference material provided, the resolution was passed by the House of Representatives on January 9, 2023. This information can be found in the text of the resolution as follows: "Passed the House of Representatives January 9, 2023."
